posts.post_content:
5 mana, for a 5/5 flyer is decent enough, especially when one of those colors is ![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol). Then you add the sac ability, and hexproof to it and this is one incredible legendary creature! I pulled this in my pre-release packs and based my deck around it. I never got to use it, but since my opponent was playing black the first round, would've been game changing had I been able to.
  
   
I may change my [thrun](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=thrun) around and make this the commander with hexproof stuff, or I may put it into [Uril](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Uril) for some enchantment beatdown.

posts.post_content:
Too powerful, I don't like it. Her abilities narrow the range of stuff that can kill her so much that she'll be format warping on her own. It'll certainly keep [Phyrexian Metamorph](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phyrexian Metamorph) and [Phantasmal Image](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phantasmal Image)'s prices pretty high and it will probably bring [Day of Judgement](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Day of Judgement) back into style quick smart.  
  
At least with Thrun (also not a fun card) you could fly over him or outsize him with a defender. Sigardia is going to remain relevant for the whole game, either hitting you or blocking.

Posted By: PinkleDadandy (5/14/2012 10:04:28 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I don't like this. Sacrifice effects always felt fair; they dodged protection, hexproof and indestructible but were always balanced by the fact that the opponent could choose their worst creature (except in the case of [Grave Pact](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grave Pact), which is broken because it makes you sacrifice *all the creatures*).  
  
[Tajuru Preserver](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tajuru Preserver) was a fair way to nerf sacrifices; it hosed them completely, but was itself vulnerable to many other forms of removal. [Leyline of Sanctity](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Leyline of Sanctity) makes [Diabolic Edict](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Diabolic Edict) a dead card for the entire game, but it's balanced by being useless against many other decks.  
  
But this... not only hoses sacrifices, it dodges everything but board wipes, fits in a lot of the same decks as [another angel that fills in the gaps in its armor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=239961), *and* is still 5 for a 5/5 flier?  
  
I hate losing to Avacyn, but I think she's fair. I really don't like Sigarda though.
posts.html:
I don't like this. Sacrifice effects always felt fair; they dodged protection, hexproof and indestructible but were always balanced by the fact that the opponent could choose their worst creature (except in the case of Grave Pact, which is broken because it makes you sacrifice all the creatures).

Tajuru Preserver was a fair way to nerf sacrifices; it hosed them completely, but was itself vulnerable to many other forms of removal. Leyline of Sanctity makes Diabolic Edict a dead card for the entire game, but it's balanced by being useless against many other decks.

But this... not only hoses sacrifices, it dodges everything but board wipes, fits in a lot of the same decks as another angel that fills in the gaps in its armor, and is still 5 for a 5/5 flier?

I hate losing to Avacyn, but I think she's fair. I really don't like Sigarda though.
